title: Looking to start a Uni club? here are some useful resources
body:
Hey everyone, 

If you're here it means you are thinking about starting a club! Read on below for some more information and helpful resources. If you have more questions make sure to comment below =)

First of all we encourage you to join existing clubs at your university if one already exists. If you find that there are no League of Legends clubs on your campus and you believe you have what it takes to be a great organiser, registering a club is simple, here are a few things you should have ready before you start:

* Identify other passionate and capable students to help organise your club
* Come up with a name for your club ( Make sure when people read it they know its League related)
* Create a communication platform for members to join and interact with each other (most existing clubs use facebook groups)
* Plan a few events in advanced so that potential club members have a reason to join

A few things to think about when starting a club

* Why does it exist? What are the goals of your club? Why would a player want to join?
* Make sure everyone on the committee has specific and defined responsibilities. Committee members should be positive members in the club and lead by example.
* Explain your club rules, fair play and player behavior. Everyone has the right to be participate, free from harassment, abuse and negative behavior.
The club committee should work hard to make this happen.  Promoting a friendly environment will help you to keep existing members and attract new ones.
* Clubs needs a regular schedule of events of all kinds.  The schedule should be established as early as possible in the year and should be widely promoted. We recommend trying to schedule an event of any size every week. 

When you do host events, make sure you check out our events portal to register your events - http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/
Not only can players go their to register for your event, but we can also provide prizing for tournaments that are registered through the portal. You can find more info about the events portal and a handy tournament guide stickied in our [community events sub board](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-events)

When you do host events make sure to take heaps of photos and upload them to twitter/facebook/instagram with #ULoLOce, we would love to see all your clubs and events!

Hey man,

best to get in touch with your club. They will let us know if we've missed anything.
What I wanna know is, do we HAVE to be in a Uni/TAFE already to Join their club and if we can just go to the Uni just for the Club but not study there?
There isn't a blanket rule. The clubs usually need to abide by certain "club rules" set forth by their uni. So it depends uni to uni.
So if the club allows players not at the uni, then you can be in the uni team?
Not quite, while some clubs are open to members from outside of the university. To participate in the tournament you need to be attending the university.
does it need to be registered at your Uni ?
Thats not a requirement. But most clubs do eventually get registered at the uni as well.
what about high school
Do i have to make a team with people exclusively from my uni or can we combine universities in the same state?
You would need to all be from the same uni. As you are representing your university at this tournament.
I am interested to start a club in Federation University in Gippsland VIC. wondering what do i need, since we dont have a web page or face book yet, but we have tones of player here.

Start a facebook group! and organise your first event =) 

Then apply on the club directory
can it be a high school team?

Hey man,
This tournament is specifically for tertiary education students (uni, tafe, etc)
We definitely want to do more for high school players in the future.

For the time being though check out our events portal where you can create tournaments and we will help support with tournament prizing - http://events.oce.leagueoflegends.com/content/faq

If you have any questions about this head on over to the community events boards - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-events/bWtno6fE-tournament-prizing-how-does-it-work
